meta.description: Desktop Environment configurations for ZenOS
Configures the GNOME desktop environment for ZenOS
meta.longDescription:
This module provides a comprehensive GNOME configuration tailored for ZenOS.
It handles the installation of core GNOME packages, audio/video plugins (GStreamer),
and manages default settings via dconf.

**Key Features:**
- Automatic extension management via UUID injection
- Integrated variable refresh rate (VRR) support for gaming
- Optional curated app suite and bloat removal
- System-wide dark mode and accent color enforcement

Integrates with `services.flatpak` and standard NixOS desktop managers.

meta.description: Primary accent color for the interface
meta.longDescription:
Sets the system-wide accent color for GNOME components and supported
GTK4 applications.

meta.description: Enable system-wide dark mode
meta.longDescription:
Whether to prefer the dark color scheme by default across the desktop
environment and applications.

meta.description: Default favorite applications in the dock
meta.longDescription:

meta.description: Whether to enable Gnome Desktop Base Module.

meta.description: Alphabetical sorting for the GNOME application grid
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Alphabetical App Grid** extension for GNOME.
It enforces alphabetical sorting on the application grid and folders, ensuring a 
consistent layout.

**Features:**
- Automatically sorts folder contents.
- Configurable positioning for folders vs files.
- Optional integration with favorite apps (GNOME 40+).

meta.longDescription: Allows displaying the favourite apps on the app grid (GNOME 40+).

meta.description: Hide specific applications from the GNOME app grid and search
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **App Hider** extension for GNOME.
It allows hiding specific applications from the application grid and search results.

**Features:**
- Hide apps from the app grid.
- Hide apps from search results.

meta.description: List of applications hidden from search

meta.description: System tray icon support for the GNOME top bar
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **AppIndicator and KStatusNotifierItem Support** extension for GNOME. It re-enables the system tray, allowing applications to 
display icons and menus in the top bar.

**Features:**
- Restores legacy tray icon support.
- Customizable icon appearance (saturation, brightness, opacity).
- Configurable tray positioning.

meta.description: Traditional category-based application menu for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Apps Menu** extension for GNOME.
It adds a traditional application menu to the top bar, organized by category.

**Features:**
- Provides a category-based application menu.
- Configurable keyboard shortcut to toggle the menu.

Customizable system resource monitor for the GNOME panel
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Astra Monitor** extension for GNOME.
It provides a customizable panel for monitoring system resources like CPU, 
GPU, memory, storage, and network usage.

**Features:**
- Customizable layout and theme.
- Support for various sensors and units.
- Detailed resource usage metrics.

meta.description: Automatic light and dark theme switching for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Auto Theme Switcher** extension for GNOME.
It automatically toggles the system theme between light and dark modes based on
custom coordinates or system location services.

**Features:**
- Set custom coordinates (Latitude/Longitude).
- Define a human-readable location name.

meta.description: Aesthetic blur effects for GNOME Shell components
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Blur My Shell** extension for GNOME.
It adds a blur look to different parts of the GNOME Shell, including the top panel,
dash, overview, and applications.

**Features:**
- Global blur settings (sigma, brightness, noise).
- Per-component configuration (Panel, Dock, Overview, Lockscreen).
- Advanced pipeline support for custom effects.
- Application whitelist/blacklist.

Retro window opening and closing animations for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Burn My Windows** extension for GNOME.
It adds retro-style window opening and closing effects, such as fire, 
tv-glitch, and hexagon.

**Features:**
- Configure active effects and profiles.
- Generate custom Nix-managed effect profiles.

meta.description: Manual and automatic screensaver inhibition for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Caffeine** extension for GNOME.
It allows users to temporarily disable the screensaver and auto-suspend modes.

**Features:**
- Quick settings toggle.
- Automatic activation for fullscreen apps or specific running applications.
- Configurable timer and duration settings.

meta.description: Automatic category-based sorting for the GNOME application grid
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Category Sorted App Grid** extension 
for GNOME. It automatically organizes the application grid by category, 
ensuring a tidy and accessible layout.

**Features:**
- Automatically sorts apps into category folders.
- Keeps the app grid organized without manual intervention.

meta.description: Whether to enable Category Sorted App Grid GNOME extension configuration.
Clipboard history management for the GNOME top bar
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Clipboard Indicator** extension for GNOME.
It adds a clipboard history menu to the top bar, allowing users to access and 
paste previously copied items.

**Features:**
- Clipboard history with configurable size.
- Private mode to prevent caching specific items.
- Customizable keyboard shortcuts.
- Option to clear history on boot or interval.

meta.description: Reorder history on use
meta.longDescription:
Whether to move items to the top of the history list

meta.description: Automatic paste upon selection
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, clicking a history item immediately pastes

meta.description: Trim whitespace from text
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, leading and trailing whitespace is automatically

meta.description: Enable image caching to disk
meta.longDescription:
Whether the extension is permitted to persist copied image

meta.description: Restrict disk cache to favorites
meta.longDescription:
Disables the registry cache file for standard items, using

meta.description: Maximum registry cache size
meta.longDescription:
The allowed size for the disk-based registry cache file

meta.description: Whether to enable Clipboard Indicator GNOME extension configuration.
Enable history deletion controls
meta.longDescription:
If true, displays 'delete' buttons on each item and provides a

meta.description: Enable periodic history clearing
meta.longDescription:

meta.description: Autoclear interval duration
meta.longDescription:

meta.description: Internal state tracker for the next scheduled clear

meta.longDescription:

meta.description: Retro 'Magic Lamp' window animation for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Compiz Alike Magic Lamp Effect** extension for GNOME. It recreates the classic "Magic Lamp" window 
minimization effect found in Compiz and macOS.

**Features:**
- Configurable animation duration.
- Adjustable grid density (tiles) for smoother or faster animations.

meta.description: Animation time in milliseconds
meta.longDescription: Total duration for the window to transition between visible and minimized states.

meta.description: Animation effect variant
meta.longDescription: Specifies the specific variant of the lamp effect to apply to windows.

meta.description: Whether to enable Compiz Alike Magic Lamp Effect GNOME extension configuration.
Horizontal mesh density
meta.longDescription:
Number of horizontal tiles used to construct the deformation mesh. 
Higher values produce smoother animations but increase CPU load.

meta.description: Vertical mesh density
meta.longDescription: Number of vertical tiles used to construct the deformation mesh.

meta.description: Wobbly window physics and animations for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Compiz Windows Effect** extension for GNOME. It adds wobbly windows and other Compiz-like 
animations to window interactions.

**Features:**
- Wobbly windows effect on movement and resize.
- Configurable physics (friction, mass, spring).

meta.description: Whether to enable Compiz Windows Effect GNOME extension configuration.
Window movement friction
meta.longDescription:
Determines how quickly window wobble energy dissipates. Lower values 
result in longer-lasting oscillations.

meta.description: Simulated window mass
meta.longDescription:
Determines the inertia of the wobble. Heavier windows feel 'sluggish' 
and wobble with greater amplitude.

meta.description: Enable wobble on maximization
meta.longDescription: Whether windows should wobble when transitioning to a maximized state.

meta.description: Enable wobble on manual resize
meta.longDescription: Whether windows should wobble while being resized by the user.

meta.description: Animation speed divisor
meta.longDescription: Scaling factor for the overall speed of the physics simulation.

meta.description: Spring stiffness constant
meta.longDescription:
Determines the 'tightness' of the wobble effect. Higher values 
make windows snap back faster.

meta.description: Horizontal mesh density
meta.longDescription:
Determines the number of points on the X-axis used to calculate 
window deformation.

meta.description: Vertical mesh density
meta.longDescription:
Determines the number of points on the Y-axis used to calculate 
window deformation.

meta.description: Advanced clipboard manager with rich UI and media support
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Copyous** extension for GNOME.
It is a feature-rich clipboard manager with support for text and images, 
offering extensive customization for its UI, behavior, and keyboard shortcuts.

**Features:**
- Clipboard history management.
- Customizable UI (orientation, position, size).
- Theming support.
- Extensive keyboard shortcuts.

date, and hint text on the lock screen.

**Features:**
- Run custom commands to display text (e.g., `whoami`).
- Customize clock style (Digital, Analog, LED).
- Adjust fonts and colors for all elements.

Highly configurable dock interface for GNOME Shell
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Dash to Dock** extension for GNOME.
It transforms the dash into a highly configurable dock that can be placed

Mobile device integration via GSConnect and KDE Connect
meta.longDescription:
This module provides deep integration for **GSConnect**, a complete implementation 
of the KDE Connect protocol for GNOME Shell.

### Features
- **Notification Sync:** Receive and reply to Android notifications on your desktop.
- **File Transfer:** Wireless sharing of files and URLs between devices.
- **Media Control:** Remotely control your desktop's media players or vice versa.
- **Telephony:** See incoming calls and SMS messages on your computer.
- **Remote Input:** Use your mobile device as a touchpad or keyboard for your PC.

This module installs and configures the **MPRIS Label** extension for GNOME.
It displays the currently playing media metadata (artist, title, etc.) in the top bar,
with customizable fields, layout, and mouse actions.

**Features:**
- Customizable metadata fields (Artist, Title, etc.).
- configurable mouse click and scroll actions.
- Extensive layout and formatting options.

Custom notification duration management for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **Notification Timeout** extension for GNOME.
It allows setting a custom timeout for notifications, ensuring they disappear
automatically after a specified duration.

**Features:**
- Configurable timeout duration in milliseconds.
- Option to ignore user idle state.
- Force all notifications to be treated as normal priority.

meta.description: Scrollable tiling window manager for GNOME Shell
meta.longDescription:
This module installs and configures the **PaperWM** extension for GNOME.
PaperWM implements a scrollable tiling window manager, inspired by 10/GUI concepts.
It arranges windows in a horizontal ribbon, allowing for efficient navigation 
and management.

**Features:**
- Scrollable tiling layout.
- Extensive keyboard navigation.
- Touchpad gesture support.
- Customizable appearance (margins, borders, minimap).

meta.description: Automated organization daemon for ZenOS user directories
meta.longDescription:
The Janitor is a background service for ZenOS designed to keep user directories 
clean and organized using various sorting strategies.

### Why use ZenFS Janitor?
- **Automation**: Automatically moves files from "dumping grounds" like Downloads to structured folders.
- **Context Awareness**: Uses different tiers of logic (rule-based, metadata-based, or ML) depending on the content.
- **Virtualization**: Provides a FUSE-based music library that organizes physical files into a virtual artist/album hierarchy without moving the originals.

### Sorting Tiers
1. **Dumb**: Fast, extension-based sorting into predefined directories.
2. **Music**: A FUSE filesystem that maps metadata (ID3 tags) to a browsable folder structure.
3. **ML**: Experimental machine-learning based classification for complex files.

Integrates with `zenos.system.zenfs` for low-level filesystem operations.

meta.description: Declarative web application (PWA) manager for ZenOS
meta.longDescription:
This module provides a framework for creating isolated, declarative web applications 
(Progressive Web Apps) using various browser backends.

### Why use this?
- **Isolation**: Each app runs in its own profile, keeping cookies separate from your main browser.
- **Integration**: Generates standard `.desktop` entries that integrate with your app launcher.
- **Routing**: Includes an optional dispatcher that intercepts links and opens them in the correct PWA.

### Key Features
- Custom CSS injection via `userChrome` and `userContent`.
- Declarative extension management.
- Deep integration with `xdg.desktopEntries` for correct window grouping.

meta.longDescription:
Specifies the underlying engine for PWAs. Firefox is the primary

meta.longDescription:
Specifies the browser package used to run Brave-based web applications. 
The package must support the `--app` and `--user-data-dir` flags.

meta.description: Chrome browser package for PWA execution

Specifies the browser package used to run Chrome-based web applications. 
Supports google-chrome, chromium, or other chromium-based browsers 
that accept the same CLI flags.

meta.longDescription: Command to execute for links that do not match any registered PWA pattern.

meta.description: Whether to enable ZenOS WebApps declarative module.
Firefox backend for ZenOS webapps
meta.longDescription:
Configures **Firefox** as the execution backend for the ZenOS WebApps system.

### Role & Status
This is the **official, supported backend** for ZenOS web applications. It leverages a custom-patched Firefox wrapper ("PWA Edition") to provide a native-like application experience.

### Key Features
- **Isolation:** Generates unique profiles (`pwa.json`, `user.js`) for each webapp.
- **Styling:** Injects `userChrome.css` to hide browser chrome (tabs, URL bar) for an app-like feel.
- **Optimization:** Aggressively strips telemetry, "pocket", and unnecessary network requests via `autoconfig.js`.
- **Native Messaging:** Supports connecting specific native hosts per-app.

### GNOME Integration
Supports the `firefox-gnome-theme` via the `firefoxGnomeTheme` option, allowing PWAs to blend seamlessly with the Adwaita aesthetic.

### Implementation Details
This module compiles a python script (`json2mozlz4.py`) to handle the proprietary `mozLz4` compression required for search engine configuration, ensuring custom search engines work inside the PWAs.

meta.description: Path to the Firefox GNOME theme directory
meta.longDescription:
Enables seamless integration with the GNOME desktop by importing the
`firefox-gnome-theme` into generated PWA profiles. This ensures that
web applications match the system's Adwaita aesthetic.

meta.description: List of packages containing native messaging hosts
meta.longDescription:
Specifies packages that provide Firefox native messaging host manifests.
These will be linked and made available to the Firefox PWA edition.

meta.description: Profile storage directory
meta.longDescription: Root path where all PWA browser profiles and configuration will be stored.

meta.description: Android to ZenOS communication bridge service
meta.longDescription:
**ZenLink User Module**

This module manages the ZenLink daemon for the current user session.
ZenLink enables audio and camera streaming between Android devices and ZenOS.

meta.description: Whether to auto-start the ZenLink daemon with the session
Enable the ZenLink Android bridge service
The ZenLink package to install
List of files ignored by ZenFS indexing

Patterns or filenames that should be skipped by the roaming and 
categorization services.

Whether to enable roaming user profile support.
Percentage of disk usage that triggers offloading logic
Target disk usage percentage after successful offload
Customized version of the Forge GNOME tiling extension
meta.longDescription:
**Forge (Custom)** is a modified build of the Forge GNOME extension, 
tailored specifically for ZenOS. It includes specific tweaks and 
patches to ensure compatibility with modern GNOME versions and 
integrates seamlessly with the ZenOS tiling workflow.

**Features:**
- Native-like tiling window management for GNOME Shell.
- ZenOS-specific compatibility patches and workflow tweaks.

meta.description: ZenLink status indicator and control interface for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
**ZenLink Indicator** provides a status icon and control interface for the 
ZenLink service. It integrates directly into the GNOME control center or 
top bar, offering quick access to device pairing, file transfers, and 
notification settings.

**Features:**
- Visual status indicator for connectivity.
- Quick access menu for common actions.

meta.description: GNOME Shell top bar clock typography override
meta.longDescription:
**Zero GNOME Clock** is a custom GNOME Shell theme component that overrides the 
default top bar clock font. It uses the custom "Zero" font to provide a minimal 
and stylized clock appearance.

**Features:**
- Applies the "Zero" font family to the clock display.
- Uses `@font-face` injection via generated CSS.
- Includes dconf profile setup for user theme integration.

meta.description: Automatic music tagger and renamer
meta.longDescription:
**Swisstag** is a powerful CLI tool for automatically tagging and organizing 
music collections. It uses MusicBrainz and other sources to fetch metadata, 
lyrics, and cover art, ensuring a clean and consistent music library.

**Features:**
- Fingerprinting via AcoustID (chromaprint).
- Metadata retrieval from MusicBrainz.
- Automated lyrics fetching via Genius.

meta.description: Convenience wrapper for nixos-rebuild switch
meta.longDescription:
**zenos-rebuild** is a wrapper script around `nixos-rebuild switch` 
specifically designed for the ZenOS environment. It provides automated 
session management and user feedback.

**Features:**
- Automates the rebuild and switch process.
- Provides desktop notifications via libnotify.
- Runs inside a tmux session for resilience.

meta.description: ZenOS bootloader automation based on rEFInd
meta.longDescription:
**ZenBoot** is an automated bootloader management tool for ZenOS, built on top 
of rEFInd. It handles the generation of boot entries, manages EFI variables, 
and applies the ZenOS branding to the boot stage.

**Features:**
- Automatic generation of rEFInd configuration.
- Integrated system profile versioning.
- Themed boot menu with custom icons.

meta.description: Automated system maintenance and optimization utility
meta.longDescription:
The ZenOS Maintenance package provides an intelligent background service that
optimizes the system during idle periods. 

**Features:**
- **Smart Idle Detection:** Monitors CPU load to run tasks when user is away.
- **Garbage Collection:** Automatically clears old Nix store paths.
- **Notifications:** Alerts the user when maintenance is completed.

meta.description: ZenOS filesystem hierarchy manager and organization service
meta.longDescription:
Provides the core logic for the ZenFS filesystem abstraction, including 
roaming user profile attachments, automated disk offloading, and the 
Janitor background service for automated file organization.

### Components
- **zenfs**: The primary dispatcher for system-level filesystem hierarchy operations.
- **zenfs-fuse**: A FUSE-based implementation providing virtual metadata-driven views.
- **zenfs-janitor**: A background service that manages rule-based file cleanup and categorization.

meta.description: The Android to ZenOS communication bridge
meta.longDescription:
**ZenLink** (formerly ZeroBridge)

ZenLink uses termux to stream PC audio to your phone and ADB to stream phone's mic and camera to your PC.
It provides a seamless integration between mobile hardware and the ZenOS desktop environment.
Configure using `zl-config` or the gnome extension (`pkgs.desktops.gnome.extensions.zenlink-indicator`).

meta.description: ZenOS signature typeface for UI and terminals
meta.longDescription:
**Zero Font** is a custom typeface designed for the ZenOS aesthetic.
It includes a standard and condensed variant, optimized for UI legibility 
and high-DPI displays.

**Features:**
- Custom glyphs and ligatures.
- Precise hinting for UI rendering.

meta.description: Extended Adwaita icon pack for ZenOS compatibility
meta.longDescription:
**Adwaita Hacks** extends the standard Adwaita icon theme with additional 
icons needed for a complete ZenOS experience. It fills in gaps where 
standard themes are missing specific application or system icons.

**Features:**
- Additional icons matching the Adwaita aesthetic.
- Seamless integration with the default GNOME icon theme.

meta.description: Core iconography set for the ZenOS environment
meta.longDescription:
**ZenOS Icons** provides the central brand iconography for the ZenOS 
desktop environment. It includes system icons, folder symbols, and 
app icons designed to match the brand's minimal aesthetic.

**Features:**
- Consistent visual style across all sizes.
- High-quality scalable vector graphics (SVG).

meta.description: ZenOS fastfetch theming and ASCII art
meta.longDescription:
**ZenOS Fastfetch** provides a custom configuration for `fastfetch` that aligns 
with the ZenOS brand. It wraps the standard `fastfetch` binary to load the 
ZenOS preset and ASCII art by default.

**Features:**
- Custom ZenOS ASCII art.
- Pre-configured JSONC preset.
- Global availability without user-level configuration.

meta.description: Branded Plymouth boot animation for ZenOS
meta.longDescription:
**ZenOS Plymouth Theme** provides a high-fidelity boot animation featuring 
animated typography and a custom breathing glow effect. It dynamically 
generates assets based on the system's branding configuration.

**Features:**
- Dynamic OS name and version label generation.
- Hardware-specific center iconography.
- Configurable animated glow effect color.

meta.description: Custom rEFInd bootloader theme for ZenOS
meta.longDescription:
**ZenOS rEFInd Theme** provides a clean, modern look for the rEFInd 
bootloader. It includes custom icons, high-resolution backgrounds, 
and configuration settings optimized for the ZenOS minimal aesthetic.

**Features:**
- Fullscreen high-detail banner support.
- Branded icon sets for various operating systems.
- Streamlined UI hiding unnecessary boot elements.
